availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Clemmans (Campbell County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Daniel Clemmans and Sarah M. Clemmans. Blacksmith in Newport, Kentucky, in 1860. Enlisted in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private on December 14, 1861. Promoted to Sergeant on January 9, 1862. Promoted to First Lieutenant on March 15,1863. Dismissed dishonorably on January 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 569.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0282.
Find A Grave, "Edward Clemmans (1843-1894)," Memorial #90589101, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90589101 (accessed September 6, 2020).
